snippet: A federal appeals court, endorsing a broad conception of executive branch secrecy, said the White House could withhold a Justice Department memo about the handing over of telephone records.
abstract: Federal appeals court rules the Obama administration may continue to withhold a Justice Department memo that apparently opened a loophole in laws protecting the privacy of consumer data; memo establishes the legal basis for telephone companies to hand over customers’ calling records to the government without a subpoena or court order, even when there is no emergency.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court, endorsing a broad conception of executive branch secrecy, said the White House could withhold a Justice Department memo about the handing over of telephone records.

headline.main: Court Grants Secrecy for Memo on Phone Data
headline.print_headline: Court Grants Secrecy for Memo on Phone Data
